channel.title: Explore Images with Google Image Swirl
channel.description:
This is a little old but w/e
Earlier this week, we announced the Labs launch of Google Image Swirl, an experimental search tool that organizes image-search results. We hope to take this opportunity to explain some of the research underlying this feature, and why it is an important area of focus for computer vision research at Google. As the Web becomes more "visual," it is important for Google to go beyond traditional text and hyperlink analysis to unlock the information stored in the image pixels. If our search algorithms can understand the content of images and organize search results accordingly, we can provide users with a more engaging and useful image-search experience.
[img]https://docs.google.com/a/google.com/File?id=ccn9mfq3_10dmqjr9gb_b[/img] http://image-swirl.googlelabs.com/

Earlier this week, we announced the Labs launch of Google Image Swirl, an experimental search tool that organizes image-search results. We hope to take this opportunity to explain some of the research underlying this feature, and why it is an important area of focus for computer vision research at Google.

As the Web becomes more “visual,” it is important for Google to go beyond traditional text and hyperlink analysis to unlock the information stored in the image pixels.
